summary: The Public Safety Retirees Healthcare Protection Act of 2025 aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code to increase the amount excluded from gross income for distributions from governmental retirement plans used for health and long-term care insurance for public safety officers. Specifically, it proposes to amend Section 402(l)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, raising the exclusion limit from $3,000 to $6,000.  The amendment would apply to distributions in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
